SENT.plain: In myelodysplastic syndromes (MDS), deletions of chromosome 7 or 7q are common and correlate with a poor prognosis
The relevant genes on chromosome 7 are unknown
We report here that EZH2, located at 7q36.1, is frequently targeted in MDS
Analysis of EZH2 deletions, missense and frameshift mutations strongly suggests that EZH2 is a tumor suppressor
As EZH2 functions as a histone methyltransferase, abnormal histone modification may contribute to epigenetic deregulation in MDS
